subject: Fix Trigger GET functionality
commitMessage:
Fix Trigger GET functionality

Due to changes in dbus interface of TelemetryService, some modifications
were needed in bmcweb:
- Some of values in TriggerActions property were renamed.
- ReportNames property was renamed and its type was changed. It is now a
  vector of object_path, each representing full dbus path of a Report
  Telemetry resource. Some additional logic was added to verify it.

Additionally, 2 issues were found during testing:
- In case of error occurring during internal data parsing, GET could
  return both "Internal Error" message and incomplete Trigger
  representation. By swapping few lines of code, this issue is fixed:
  now either error is returned or full Trigger representation, but never
  both of them.
- NumericThresholds object was parsed as 'null' in case of missing
  thresholds. It should be an empty json {} instead.

Testing done:
- TriggerActions are properly translated to redfish names.
- Links are now returning proper uris of existing MRD.
- Internal Error is returned for malformed data returned by service.
- Other Trigger GET functionality remained unchanged.

Signed-off-by: Szymon Dompke <szymon.dompke@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Ed Tanous <edtanous@google.com>
Change-Id: I81ebbf3889a152199bef7230de56a73bb112731b

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 3f215c926c25b5e6afed4eb36e0edd2ed4462dc6

If something like this happens we should set error. User needs to know that there is report with invalid ReportNames and action is required. It should never happen, but in case of some bugs in the code it will be clear what needs to be fixed.
Error is set: nullopt is being checked for in line 236, which then return false from fillTrigger() and InternalError will be set in line 342.
Ack
As a class of problem, how can we ensure that we don't merge bugs like this to master in the future?  Are there any tools we can use to help improve the testing?
Do you mean first problem related to '/' character or second problem related to response containing both error and some fields?
Either.  Both of these are things where we didn't implement to the specification, and reall what I'm asking is whether they could've been avoided by testing with dmtf tooling?

Sending few post request (or directly via dbus call to telemetry service) which creates some example triggers then running service validator could catch those errors. Error related to 

We are very careful to make it right at the first attempt. This code was tested before pushing this change, but we overlooked one of the parameters.

Issue with error messages is much harder to detect, input validation will not allow such trigger to be added using redfish api https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/44935/23. To produce this error trigger needs to be added via dbus call (this validation can only be done in redfish since it is correct from dbus point of view).

Also POST trigger is not yet available in bmcweb/master so users are not affected by this issues.

First issue was mostly related to mistake during testing on telemetry side. As the POST is in progress, we could only test it by creating triggers on dbus, and this particular param was not passed correctly.

As for message/error mixing, this flow is almost impossible to reproduce if backend telemetry service is working properly. Easiest way would be by using incompatible version of service. But it could be caught in review - now that I know what to look after I will do my best no prevent it in the future.
Ack
Isn't this expected to be a fully qualified URI?  ie "/redfish/v1/TelemetryService/..."
No, it is more like an object_path, I changed code below to reflect it better.
Looks good now.
Common error #12.  Please read and understand the common errors document.  I suspect this needs to be using the sdbusplus::message::object_path methods.
Done
Please use the "urlFromPieces" method for this.
There were many places where it could be used, so I created helper methods in separate commit and will rebase this change on top of it.
please use the urlFromPieces method for this.
Ack, see previous answer.

patchset as written looks ok.  Sorry for the long time to review, it fell behind in the queue.

Get it rebased (or I can rebase it as I have time) and we can get this merged.
Done
Sorry for not pointing this stuff out earlier.

Why does this need checked?  Also, this check seems a little odd, this would imply that the dbus path being passed in here is /TelemetryService/<name>

Generally dbus paths start with /xyz/.  Is it possible this is actually a url that we need to parse (and should be using the url parsing semantics for?)

"Reports" at this level is coming from dbus.

> It is not an url, it is relative path, which should always be "TelemetryService/{SomeID}",

From a dbus perspective, that's not true, and we shouldn't be verifying it in bmcweb.  That amounts to business logic.


Correct, object_path doesn't support relative paths.


> So in summary, we have relative path-like string. It is not an url and not an object_path. What do you suggest to parse it properly?

Why is the interface defined this way?  We pulled this string from dbus, which should never be sending a relative dbus path.

I completely agree. As for the interface - it was defined some time ago, but it can be changed, especially now that POST is not yet implemented. I will prepare change in backend TelemetryService to use proper dbus path, and I will come back to this change in a day or two, depending on how long it will take me to test and merge.
Now it is a proper dbus path :)
Done
Sorry for not catching this sooner, filename() can fail, which needs checked.
Ack, but lets discuss your comment above, before changing the code.
Done

Took me a little longer than I expected, but I needed time to make sure that changing Telemetry dbus api won't break anything. Found 1 very minor issue, so I am including fix for it in this commit too. Commit message was modified to reflect changes.
No worries.  Thanks for making the change.
I made a couple minor tweaks to some json typing information, this should be good to merge.
LGTM
